name: market for landed anchovy, fresh | landed anchovy, fresh | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18917/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'landed anchovy, fresh', in the Global geography.;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of landed anchovy from the harbor or port that is landed till the place where it is later sold for commercial or private consumption. No losses are considered in this dataset.;The product 'landed anchovy, fresh' is a wild-caught fish landed whole at the port.

The activity starts with the reception of landed anchovy.

The activity ends with the provision of anchovy for commercial or private consumption.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data are intended to reflect current equipment and processes on a Global level.

exchanges.description:
The majority of landed anchovy is not transported but rather directly pumped to the reduction plants. The amount of transportation here represents the transport of landed anchovy that is actually driven to the market for human consumption. Circa 2% of the total global production volume of landed anchovy is driven to the market for human consumption. The value if calculated by also assuming a transportation distance of 472 km/ton.

Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics.
